text: Relapse, my friend. Welcome me yet again with open arms.

I guess I am pretty depressed again. The more I think about it, the more I realize that it just looks differently this time.
I don't know what I'm saying or doing anymore. It's taken me 15 minutes to write this comment and I've barely said anything

Can’t do this anymore. I haven’t been this bad in a long time. Feel like I’m in an almost half-conscious state. Like I’ve just completely fucking mentally shut down. All I’ve been doing today is crying and smoking. Barely eating. Barely existing. This has happened before, last year, just completely broke, I can’t even remember how I managed to pull myself out of it. I can’t do this anymore. If I wasn’t so scared of fucking it up I’d have jumped off a bridge by now.
No interest in doing anything except talk to people. At least I got reddit to not feel lonely.

I am really struggling, apparently more than I realized. I was headed to NH to hike and climb this weekend, I got over the boarder (over an hour drive at this point) and realized I left my boots at home. I am now home but cried all the way home and a bit here, basically for two hours now. My anxiety has been bad but didn't realize I am just so depressed and unhappy.
I just want to hike and climb more outside, but finding partners since I moved down here has been impossible for the type of climbing I want to do. Also ones that are kind, understanding and reliable. I am so exhausted about it and just so lonely at the same time. I feel everyone hates me and I am just a burden to people.

My parents have relocated whole family multiple times and it really never gets any easier. I had to move away from all my friends that I made over the past 11 years, and my ex who I still have feelings for, and apparently he still does too, but he can't deal with a long distance relationship. And he's already in a new relationship.
Ive been forced to move to a new country where I truly have no one. My parents argue every single day. My mum is stuck in a mentally, emotionally and financially abusive relationship. I have no one to talk to about my issues. Im working in a dead end job.
Therapy helped, but it's getting more expensive and with how little I earn I can no longer afford it even with subsidies. My depression is still such a heavy, heavy thing. I can't do anything right.
My friends in the previous country i was in recently got into their own relationships and now they never talk to me or message me or even want to play video games or chat or something or even half an hour, or even just a few minutes. I'm always the one trying to check up on them. I understand that their relationships will take priority. But I wonder if I'm bothering them and being annoying somehow. And I am really, really, really alone and the arguments in my family make me not want to talk to them about my issues because I constantly end up being blamed for everything even if it isn't my fault. I also have a chronic health condition and even though its well controlled, I feel even more like a burden to everyone around me, its not even like people don't think like that, the people in my life have told me a few times in anger. so unaliving myself is becoming increasingly more tempting again as time passes. It's getting really hard to deal with the loneliness and my own depression. I can't get out of my bed. I can't do anything right in my life. I stay up at night wondering where everything went wrong. What did I do to deserve this.
I deleted all my 350GB of hentai manga today. I couldn't take it anymore. This porn addiction on top of my depression is too much. It has to go today. First day of getting my life back. Wish me luck.

just had a wave of depression come over me. these past two weeks i've been sick so the only thing i felt was exhaustion. now that i'm better it's like my brain is saying, "oh you're feeling better? well it's not like you have anyone who cares about you either way" :/

My Hormones are going absolutly crazy because I confirmed my sexsuall orientation for me and stopped using my anti-depressants. I constantly overthink and its draging down on my productivity, social contacts and everyday life. My coping mechanisms dont seem to work because I "over-used" them if that makes sense. All I want is some clearity but the only thing thats clear right now is that need Rehab. Everyday is suffering. Everday is Pain and if only a fraction of what im overthinking is right, im gonna have realy hard time recovering. I just need love.

Keep in mind the strongest protection is an inner love of yourself. If you manage to build on it and grow it, then you can brush off depressing events much easier. Easier said than done but at the same time it's that one thing all happy people have in common.

I'm tired of ruining opportunities for myself and I'm tired of my habits and way of life. I get stuck in fantasy. I can walk up and down my little room completely stuck in my own head. Living out elaborate alternatives for how my life could have gone with varying degrees of realism if this had gone differently or I had just done this or whatever. Hours can go by without me noticing of just me imagining myself happy, thinking about what I could have done or who I could have been if I didn't keep fucking everything up. It really gets in the way of me taking what steps I do try to take to try to actually make it to the fantasies.
Also fuck fuck fuck fuck FUCK sleep disorders. This whole depression thing or whatever could probably be manageable for me if it weren't for chronic insufferable sleep problems. I have tracked my sleep habits obsessively over an extended period of time over multiple lifestyles of mine and I've realized some things. When I have had long periods without deadlines or responsibilities, when I am allowed to wake up and fall asleep when I please for months on end, I have a surprising amount of clarity. I even get to a point where I start to doubt whether I even have some kind of disorder or anything like that. In these periods, my sleep schedule naturally and consistently drifts to the side at all times. One monday I'll wake up at 7am, the next I'll wake up at 2pm, the next midnight, the next 6am. It takes about a month or so for my sleep schedule to do a full 360 rotation. It's very consistent and I hardly even notice this. Its just me falling asleep whenever I want and waking up whenever I want and it feels great, really. 
But when I have deadlines and responsibilities, and I have to be awake at 7am monday through friday every single week, is when the problems start. Its when I start having to make tradeoffs and calculations with sleep. Its when I have bursts of insomnia and hypersomnia. I can stay aligned with the socially acceptable sleep schedule for at most a week, but it just takes one little nudge to completely ruin everything very quickly. I get periods where I physically cannot fall asleep. I can stay awake in a dark room staring at the ceiling for hours and hours on end, no matter how exhausted I am. Brain just racing, stressed, annoyed, and cannot sleep. Sleep medication? Benadryl works at making me fall asleep, almost too effectively. But the problem is that it isn't a solution: its just one more thing to factor into the calculations. If I'm having an insomniac period and I take my benadryl, more often than not it will take me out for about 12 hours. I sleep through my alarm and miss one and a half morning lectures. That's fine, its better than sleeping all through the day or getting only an hour of sleep and falling asleep in the middle of the day in the library and ruining my sleep schedule in one of those ways. So now that I've slept for 12 hours, I've also shifted my sleep schedule over to the right by about 4 hours, as I've woken up later than I expected to after taking my meds late and waking up late. So now when I go through my day and its finally time for me to go to sleep, I've been awake for 10 hours only. And it's pretty hard to fall asleep meaningfully for the entire night when I've only been awake for 10 hours, especially considering my 'natural' sleep-wake cycle adds up to about 26 hours on average (meaning id have to sleep for 16 hours to match my natural sleep cycle), so I try to take my meds so I can fall asleep at all but instead I only take a 3 hour nap because I wasn't sleepy enough to fully sleep, so now I'm benadryl groggy and exhausted but wired awake at 2am and probably about to suddenly fall back asleep in about 3 hours and now my sleep schedule is really fucked. All this because of one frequent event after taking my meds. Whether I take my sleeping meds or not is irrelevant to whether my schedule is going to be fucked up, and I'm going to be missing classes missing deadlines and screwing shit up regardless. It's just one thing I need to factor into my sleep trade off calculations. And this is just one example, there are so many scenarios and events that occur in my sleep chronicle that I couldn't even recall and detail them all. Every single god damn day I have to go through this shit and it's so damn nice to just not have any deadlines and just sleep whenever I want. I've heard it all about sleep hygiene or drinking some fucking tea or whatever and none of it is a solution: its either worthless or just one extra factor in the problem.
It feels so fkn good to just follow my natural schedule and not have to live to the normal standard, but that doesn't fly in the world unfortunately. I'm simply incompatible with this world, I can't work with it. I don't want to enter it, I want to stay in my hole and never leave or look out or do anything. Why should I go to the world? What do they have for me? I don't need any of it. I'm at my best when I'm alone, hermited away, reading my little books and playing my little games. That is when I feel good. The stress and the pain happens when I start feeling so comfortable after not going outside for months that I decide to re-register for university or something stupid like that. I know its what I should do, in many ways its what I want to do, but I really can't handle it. I can't live up to the world. I've realized there is a disorder called 'non 24 hour sleep wake disorder' and I am completely convinced that I have to have something like this, the testimonies I read and signs and symptoms hit so close to home.
Has anyone ever tried inpatient treatment?

I have been working for a month, and I'm already struggling. I have nothing to do at my job. I know this is quite unusual and that it could be the dream job for a lot of people. "Getting paid to do nothing? Sign me in!", someone would say. But the thing is the job is really far from home and I feel like a piece of shit every day, like a useless paper weight. An expensive and privileged paper weight, but useless nevertheless.
I don't know if this is my depression taking over, but I missed work two days in a row. I told them I was dealing with some personal problems, my boss didn't write me back. I'm abandoning the job. This is what I always do. The worst part of this is that I desperately need the money.
Honestly, though, it's clear this job is a dead-end. As soon as my contract is over, I'm sure they'll lay me off. My contract ends as soon as late February. So there's not a lot of future for me anyway.
I decided to go back to work tomorrow, but I'm afraid I might be fired. It's probably well deserved. I'm such a piece of garbage, I hate myself for not being able to keep this job.

i want to go home and hug my dog and my mom i miss her so much. im so tired of living here. i can’t pack my bags and return there because i know my life as someone who’s identity will probably never be respected, and i’ll never have the life i’m dreaming for. but i feel so miserable here. i don’t know how to open up, i feel as if i no longer have a personality besides the constant self hatred and paranoia. i’ve fucked up and my health is at a decline. everything feels like shit and i feel alone. and i dont know what to make of my future anymore. i’m tired of just playing along with others, going to work and trying to pass as a ‘normal’ being in a vain attempt to not be avoided. i still dont know how to open up, i still dont know how to communicate at my age, i still feel like a damaged person. what good is damage when i havent learnt anything from it. anything useful, not destructive. i feel disgusting and ugly and i struggle with aging and seeing what i used to be even just okay with fading away. i have nothing . i don’t know .

Guess a rant that makes no sense:
I guess I thought I had a meaningful relationship with either of my exes but I'm finding it hard to believe. Both times it was mainly just me having to force things. They were so disinterested and only dated me as long as they did until they found someone better. They simply just did not see me as someone to have a future with. It's kind of fucked up and probably better to be alone. My awkwardness and gloominess is terrible, yeah I know. I get it. I hate me too. I always felt the lack of love in his eyes and how he never said he loved me when I would say it. And I feel like I deserved it. I deserved being used and being a stepping stone for their happiness. I can't ever be myself. I'm sorry I'm an awful person. And I'm so pathetic. For still thinking about him even though he broke up with me to date someone better. And he's probably showing her his best parts. With me, he was crying about his ex or crying about how unacomplished he feels. And always saying he doesn't love me and doesn't know if he could. And making me feel bad for not being who he wanted. Sorry I wasn't enough for you. I really loved you. I guess I thought he would change his mind but I'm an empty person. I don't love me either. I guess the biggest problem was intimacy. I'm sorry I couldn't have sex. I'm sorry I'm a broken and failed human. I really tried for you. I don't blame you for leaving. And I'm not crying that you're gone anymore. I'm crying now because I'm so alone and have always been alone. Even with you. Your breaking up with me is just a reminder of how I'm unable to have a proper relationship. I'm just someone who gets used. I just feel so broken. I see so many happy couples and it makes me feel even more alone because I never had that and never will.

Things don't seem to ever change. Seems like I keep chasing happiness only to wind up in the same dark hole as always. things with my second marriage have already began to fall apart and I find myself once again feeling as though I'm not capable of being loved. I don't deserve it. What's wrong with me

hello, just need a place to dump. I'm turning 27 next months, and aside from university, i've got absolutely nothing to show for in my life. i don't have any friends, i've never been able to stick with any hobbies, and even though i was exercising well for the last year or so, i've hit a completely brick will with my energy levels and i can't even bring myself to go for a short walk these days. i'm stuck living at home with my parents at the moment, and whilst well-meaning, are completely awful at any emotional support, and usually just end up berating me for 'thinking too emotionally' when i try to open up about anything, and usually don't accept any perspectives of what they think is correct. i'm so withdrawn from the world, and i can't even be truly present and focus on conversations at moment for some reason. 
i'm also leaving the country and moving to canada in six weeks, and now i'm terrified that i'm just gonna eat concrete and fuck everything up the second i get off the plane because i'm arriving with such awful mental health. how the hell am i supposed to make friends and settle in a new country when i think of myself as such a failure that even basic conversations seem like a struggle right now. this should be the opportunity of a lifetime but now it feels like it's the only option i have to get away from a world where i've just fucked about for 26 years with nothing to show. at least when i'm in canada i have the excuse of being new as to explain why i have no friends.
it seems like even when things should be getting better, i'm not. at this point i'm just damaged goods

I'm so conflicted on how to feel about myself. I genuinely wish that i was never born, and wish that i would just cease to exist so that i could die without anyone that did care about me, to not have to worry about me. i feel so stressed about everything, from my study path to my career of choice, and yet i have just barely become a legal adult. 
it feels like there’s no where for me to turn to, nobody for me to talk to. the last time i felt safe enough to open up and talk to someone who i considered a close friend, someone who i had genuinely loved, later told me that opening to her was triggering for her, and when we broke up, told me she wasn’t satisfied with my answer of “giving myself time and space for my mental health”. 
i don’t know how to approach things anymore, i feel like i’ve just….become dumber. more stupider. i lack the same awareness that my peers have, feeling like a shell every single day i go to class. yet at the same time, i feel obligated to go. and when i did end up making new friends, i feel like i fucked it all up, saying things i don’t realize are insensitive or just not realizing that some things just shouldn’t be said at all. i feel guilty for some things i’ve done, or some things i’ve said, but i get too scared to talk to them about it and apologize, because i convince myself that they’ll just hate me even more. 
yet whenever i attempt to make friends, it feels like it starts off ok but as time goes on, i just end up never replying. not because i hate them, but just that it’s so….hard. it’s so hard to tell people that because i’m depressed, just sending a reply to someone is hard. 
it all feels so debilitating. i have no motivation to work, or draw, or improve myself. my vocabulary becomes more limited, my skills are deteriorating rather than improving, i have no more passion for everything. it feels like i’ve messed up being a friend, a girlfriend, a sister, a daughter, everything. i end up shunning myself and cause others to shun me as well. 
i wish that i could just die. it doesn’t feel like there’s a point to continue living. i daydream about ways to die, from natural disasters or man-made accidents, to just actively killing myself. 
i didn’t really feel like writing this much, but why not since it feels like another bout of insomnia is coming up? even if i could have written this in a journal to myself, i just wanted to put something out there into a void of sorts without the pressure of friends knowing and so that i can at least get the small speck of relief that someone can read this without messaging or interacting with me.
I feel like even just existing is using up all my energy and the minute I’m not talking to someone and pretending I’m ok then I just break down and want to cey
Same here, the problem is I'm having a hard time even crying in the first place.

I feel like I’m drowning. I’m headed into my 30s and feel like I’ve wasted my entire 20s over someone who can’t get their shit together, has drained my life savings. Yet I can’t find the strength to even do laundry, let alone leave. I can’t set boundaries. I would rather suffer in silence than hurt someone I love or even someone I don’t even know. I accepted a new position at a job I have no experience doing and part of the job is being assertive and I just can’t do it. I sit in my office 8 hours a day just staring into oblivion. I get home and can do nothing more than sit in the clutter I scream at myself to clean, but I feel like a plant on the couch and can’t find even a shred of motivation to clean up. I don’t know what it will take to fix it. I don’t know how to change and I feel like I’m watching my best years pass me and it’s the most exhausting, hollowing feeling. I’m missing out on experiences and life because my depression is swallowing me whole. I’ve googled hundreds of ways to fix it, or make myself feel better by releasing some chemicals in my brain, but can’t bring myself to do anything but sit and cry and wish I was better. I hope I can get better.

I'm so depressed today I couldnt eat. I called in sick to work and laid in the floor. I went for a walk and drank tons of black coffee and found ways to hate on everything I saw. I walked in the cold until I couldn't feel my feet and kept walking until hunger and cold made me feel like I was going faint. I wanted to pass out and just lay there until my body froze. I made it home and laid on the floor again and fell asleep. I finally ate. I wanted to make it 24 hours without eating for some reason but didn't quite make it.
I have a wife and kids and I've been their solid ground for so long. For a decade I put them first but it eroded my own sense of self or something. As the kids got older their emotional needs grew, so did my wife's. My resposibilities and pressures just grew and continue to grow with no end in sight. I started smoking pot constantly. We had a handful of various small family "stresses" about money and physical health and the emotional bottom of the whole thing just fell out. I had a horrible row with my wife. Now I'm in freefall. I threw away all my pot a couple of days ago. It felt like a productive way to hurt myself. It was like my best buddy and I killed it. Good! I hate it.
Now I'm here on the floor writing this. I feel like I'm on the bottom of an aquarium, like a dying piece of coral. I'm not asking for help. I don't care if anyone reads this. I just needed to write it.

I understand this and I hear you. I’m the wife and mom in my story. Recovering alcoholic, battling depression and autoimmune diseases. Still trying to find solutions. Living for husband and child mainly tho bc I’m empty inside.
Thank you for reading and sharing and understanding.
I feel like my body is hard to use. Like, I don’t have the energy. A lot to say but can’t put the energy into it.

God January is always the worst fucking month for my mental health. Feeling very very low tonight. Going to fucking destroy my body with alcohol and try to not kill myself, cause someone needs to finish these projects :(
i just wanna kill myself. i can’t fucking sleep and i hate my whole life

I think I'm just more sad when I'm off my meds. Also started getting a cold. It's too cold in my room at night and I don't wrap my legs with a blanket and put on a coat every time. Starting my bootcamp.
i'm ruminating too much over the past again becuase i can barely make out what even happened. on the brighter side i scheduled my dentist appointments for this week.
Feel like I’ve been doing a lot better, proud of the progress I’ve made in the past month or so. I was in an inpatient facility and it helped tremendously
That’s great. I did an inpatient 3 yrs ago, right before the pandemic. Then their IOP.

It’s been a little difficult without my therapist. I’ve been trying to cope while finding a new one, but there just aren’t any that fall under my budget. It’s getting harder to combat the occasional negative self-talk. Ugh
I wanna make the right decissions for me and the people arround me without hurting myself or the people arround me.

I'm up when I shouldn't be up.  I'm having feelings that I don't even know what to make of them.
I don't know why I'm like this.  Right now I'm not even sad, I'm not indifferent, I'm just here?  Not the nice, nirvana, everpresent here, I'm sitting here on my bed.  Okay, so... but why?  Why am I here?  Why do I exist?  I know I have to figure out the answer myself but either I'm too dumb to do it, too scared to do it, or I'm already living the answer, I guess.  
I feel like... no one truly understands me and I've given up trying to connect with others because it doesn't work out.  I feel like I've tried so hard and for what?  For nothing, really.  And I know the common denominator is me, I know it.  And I know I'm not the easiest person to deal with, but I don't think I'm the worst person either. 
I know my negativity eats me alive, steals my time, steals my quality of life.  My negativity just permeates through me.  I was driving yesterday thinking like... I feel like I waded through wet concrete and stopped and now it's dried and I'm stuck and I feel like part of the concrete.  I feel like someone/something poured concrete in me and I can't move, therefore, I don't know what the point is.  I'm here but I can't do anything.  I can't will myself to do anything because there is no point.  I type on here because I can't talk about this with anyone.  
I wish I knew why I'm here.  I wish I knew if I was good.  I don't feel like a good person.  I don't think I am a good person.  I carry a lot of negative thoughts about people.  I'm so judgmental of other people.  I'm so angry at people.  I'm so sad at people.  I feel dumb.  I feel unattractive.  I feel juvenile.  I feel blank.
Why am I here?  I feel like I'm blowing it.  I feel like I'm wasting time with whatever it is I'm supposed to be doing here.  I'm not good at life.

I'm just so tired of my life, i don't want to "get better" anymore. I wish I never existed, I've spent so long chasing money thinking it would bring me happiness but at the end of the day all it did was distract me from my problems.
Am having an actual shit day. Crying and off all day — literally for nothing. Depression is weird.
I hear you. Wish I could help. What series on tv do you like? I’m looking for recommendations.

So I got an appointment with the doctor yesterday, it’s a month away, but not much to do about that. Hopefully I can get a referral then. Last time I tried it was a long waitlist. 
My depression is fluctuating a lot, my anxiety is easily triggered and I feel mostly shame. For everything and nothing. I cry a couple times a day, except when I can feel nothing. Or it just doesn’t reach the surface. 
I have a meeting about work at one of my jobs next week, cause I have been gone more than present, just constantly being sick it seems. So maybe I’ll lose my job. And I don’t know what I’ll do then. 
I seem to often disappoint my family, my job, and anyone else that looks at me.
Shame sucks so bad. What are some books you’ve read more than once, or cd, or series on streaming? I’m looking for recommendations.
just going to kill myself my life is worth absolutely nothing

Thats not true, people care about you and your life is just as important as any other being on this planet. Who cares what other people think of you. The important people in your life are all that matter. Forget the internet trolls.

I wish you didn’t feel that way. I don’t know allllll the rules yet, so I’ll just say that if everyone could read everyone else’s mind and anybody that I know, had that thought, I would immediately offer myself as support to that person in any way I could. <3

Growing up in an environment where expressing your feelings was frowned upon; where your 26yo teacher telling the whole class “crying is for the weak” got stuck in your memory, a song talking about how you can just cry and don’t have to feel shameful about it feels so powerful and freeing. Of course, now that I’m around her age, I realized one of the adults I was looking up to at the time didn’t know everything and she was figuring things out, too.
What if my inner critic is right? Everything I think about is true. I have no talent, I'm not attractive, and I annoy everyone I hang out with. How am I supposed to ignore that?
I feel like I don't feel anything anymore.  It doesn't even scare me how much I don't care anymore.  I don't know how it ended up here.
I'm only here because they want me here.

M. 
I’m trying to make changes to my life. Typically I get off work, night shift, and get high till noon pass out and repeat. Now I’ve been doing the same except o don’t take anything before doing 2 tasks. Like doing my laundry and dish, or picking up trash and cleaning something. But this only solves my productivity. 

I don’t do anything like go out with friends, unless we are going to someone’s home. I don’t have alot of spare money and I don’t want to have to sell my car. The thought of that fucks me up, I know it’s a car but I spent 3 years searching. I have a hard time relating to new people I meet sense I don’t care for typical sports, music or movies. So idk how to talk to them.
I want to get a degree so im doing something I like, but idk how it would be possible as I don’t have financial freedom. And im old now, is 5 years of school worth it? Im still weighing it out. 
Idk im just ranting, typing it out is quite therapeutic to me.
i always find a way to fuck things up

New year, new nihilistic tendencies. 
Here’s to another year of meaningless interactions, thoughts and desires.

Um, I just read this and laughed so hard. Bc I get it! Seriously. Thank you. I needed that laugh…I’ve been sitting here totally numb, all day doing basically nothing. Trying to get my new insurance set up-to go to endless new Dr appts and maybe find something to pull me out of this dark pit.
